greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Maximal exponent in prime factorization of 3-smooth numbers.
link: Robert Israel, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
maple: N:= 10^20: # to include all 3-smooth numbers <= N
map(p -> p[2], sort(S,(a,b) -> a[1]<b[1])); # _Robert Israel_, Aug 10 2014
mathematica: S = Flatten[Table[Table[{2^i*3^j, Max[i, j]}, {j, 0, Floor[Log[3, M/2^i]]}], {i, 0, Floor[Log[2, M]]}], 1] // Sort;
results.author: _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Jul 18 2003
